info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 8:47PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM MDT... At 847 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near San Jon, or 24 miles southeast of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... San Jon, Grady, Broadview, Wheatland, and Bellview. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 353 and 360. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for east central New Mexico.
